detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

service.description: the name of the service owning the policy

ric.description: identity of the target Near-RT RIC

keepAliveIntervalSeconds.description: keep alive interval for the service. This is a heartbeat supervision of the service, which in regular intevals must invoke a 'keepAlive' REST call. When a service does not invoke this call within the given time, it is considered unavailble. An unavailable service will be automatically deregistered and its policies will be deleted. Value 0 means no timeout supervision.

callbackUrl.description: callback for notifying of RIC synchronization

state.description: Represents the states for a Near-RT RIC

callback_url.description: callback for notifying of Near-RT RIC state changes

keep_alive_interval_seconds.description: keep alive interval for the service. This is a heartbeat supervision of the service, which in regular intevals must invoke a 'keepalive' REST call. When a service does not invoke this call within the given time, it is considered unavailble. An unavailable service will be automatically deregistered and its policies will be deleted. Value 0 means no timeout supervision.

timeSinceLastActivitySeconds.description: time since last invocation by the service

callbackUrl.description: callback for notifying of RIC synchronization

callback_url.description: callback for notifying of RIC synchronization

time_since_last_activity_seconds.description: time since last invocation by the service

policy_schema.description: Policy type json scema. The schema is a json object following http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema

ric_id.description: identity of the target Near-RT RIC

transient.description: if true, the policy is deleted at RIC restart. If false, its value is maintained by this service until explicitly deleted. Default false.

service_id.description: the identity of the service owning the policy

status_notification_uri.description: Callback URI for policy status updates

service_callback_info_v2.description: Information transferred as in Service callbacks (callback_url)

values:
AVAILABLE: the  Near-RT RIC has become available for A1 Policy management

Returns a list of A1 policies matching given search criteria.
If several query parameters are defined, the policies matching all conditions are returned.

get.summary: Returns info for one Near-RT RIC
get.description:
Either a Near-RT RIC identity or a Mananged Element identity can be specified.
The intention with Mananged Element identity is the ID used in O1 for accessing the traffical element (such as the ID of CU).

parameters.name: managed_element_id
parameters.description: The identity of a Managed Element. If given, the Near-RT RIC managing the ME is returned.

parameters.name: ric_id
parameters.description: The identity of a Near-RT RIC to get information for.

parameters.name: ric_id
parameters.description: Select types for the given Near-RT RIC identity.

parameters.name: type_name
parameters.description: Select types with the given type name (type identity has the format <typename_version>)

parameters.name: compatible_with_version
parameters.description: Select types that are compatible with the given version. This parameter is only applicable in conjunction with type_name. As an example version 1.9.1 is compatible with 1.0.0 but not the other way around.

get.summary: Returns the contents of the configuration file
get.description: Note that the file contents is not relevant if the Consul is used.

404.description: File is not found or readable

put.summary: Replace the current configuration file with the given configuration
put.description: Note that the file is ignored if the Consul is used.

500.description: Something went wrong when replacing the configuration. Try again.

parameters.description: If the policy is transient or not (boolean defaulted to false). A policy is transient if it will be forgotten when the service needs to reconnect to the Near-RT RIC.

info.description:
General

The O-RAN Non-RT RIC Policy Management Service provides a REST API for management of A1 policices.
The main tasks of the service are:

  • A1 Policy creation, modification and deletion.
  • Monitoring and maintaining consistency of the SMO view of A1 policies and the Near-RT RICs
  • Maintaining a view of supported Near-RT RIC policy types
  • Supervision of using services (R-APPs). When a service is unavailble, its policies are removed.

APIs provided by the service

A1 Policy Management

This is an API for management of A1 Policies.

  • A1 Policy retrieval, creation, modification and deletion.
  • Retrieval of supported A1 Policy types for a Near-RT RIC
  • Retrieval of status for existing A1 policies

Management of configuration

API for updating and retrieval of the component configuration. Note that there other ways to maintain the configuration.

Callbacks

These are endpoints that are invoked by this service. The callbacks are registerred in this service at service registration.

NearRT-RIC Repository

This is an API that provides support for looking up a NearRT-RIC. Each A1 policy is targeted for one Near-RT RIC.

Health Check

API used for supervision of the PMS component.

Service Registry and Supervision

API used for registerring services that uses PMS. Each A1 policy is owned by a service. PMS can supervise each registerred service and will automatically remove policies for unavailable services.
info.title: A1 Policy management service
